column2: Nenets: Тут'ын) is a town on the Yenisei River and the administrative center of Taymyrsky Dolgano-Nenetsky District of Krasnoyarsk Krai
column3: Russia. It used to be the administrative center of Taymyr Autonomous Okrug
column4: which was merged into Krasnoyarsk Krai on January 1

column1: It was founded in 1667 as a winter settlement connected to Mangazeya. In 1930 it was designated the administrative center of the Taimyr Dolgan-Nenets National Region. In 1935
column2: the polar explorer Otto Schmidt recommended that the settlement be expanded into a town. By 1937
column3: the port facilities and a railroad to Norilsk were completed. Town status was granted in 1951.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Dudinka serves as the administrative center of Taymyrsky Dolgano-Nenetsky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Taymyrsky Dolgano-Nenetsky District as the district town of Dudinka. As a municipal division
column6: the district town of Dudinka is incorporated within Taymyrsky Dolgano-Nenetsky Municipal District as Dudinka Urban Settlement.

column1: Dudinka processes and sends cargo via Norilsk railway to the Norilsk Mining and Smelting Factory and also ships non-ferrous metals
column3: the Messoyakha-Dudinka-Norilsk natural gas pipeline was laid.

column1: Dudinka is a port in the lower reaches of the Yenisei River
column2: accessible to seagoing ships. The town is served by the Dudinka Airport.
516 ft) tall radio mast which was formerly used for the CHAYKA radio navigation system. It is a grounded mast with a rhombic cage antenna.

column1: Despite lying more than a degree and a half above the Arctic Circle
column2: Dudinka has a subarctic climate (Köppen climate classification Dfc) with short
column3: mild summers and severely cold winters. Precipitation is moderate; it falls mostly as rain in summer and mainly as snow throughout the rest of the year.

column1: The Taymyr ice arena is the newly built ice hockey
column2: figure skating and curling facility in Dudinka. It is the northernmost ice arena in the world that is fit for holding high-level
column3: international events. The spectators capacity of the arena is 350 seats. The 2017 CCT Arctic Cup took place in the city of Dudinka at the Taymyr ice arena on May 18–22
column4: 2017. It was the first-ever international curling tournament among women teams beyond the Arctic Circle. The event was held with participation of 8 strongest teams from the northern countries
column5: located at the 69th parallel. Participant teams included Russian National Team
column9: Team Finland. A wild card from the Organizing Committee was granted to Team Switzerland. Since 2017 Dudinka becomes the place where the international Arctic Curling Cup tournament takes place annually.  The test event for this tournament was TAYMYR CURLING CUP 2016. The first-ever curling tournament among men teams beyond the Arctic Circle took place in Dudinka on May 26–30
column10: 2016. The tournament was held as a test event for the Arctic Curling Cup. Six strongest Russian men teams took part in the event. In 2018 Dudinka held the final tour of the international Arctic Curling Cup. 10 strongest teams
column12: were competing in double-mixed. Maria Komarova and Daniel Goryachov received bronze medals in this tournament.

column1: Dudinka is the birthplace of famous Russian poet Olga Martynova.
